code: var Disk = require('./disk.js');
var Operation = require('./operation.js');
var streamRouter = require('../common/stream-router.js');
var util = require('../common/util.js');
var VM = require('./vm.js');

tags.string: {module:compute} compute - Compute object this zone belongs to.
tags.name: compute

tags.html:
var gcloud = require('gcloud')({
keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json',
projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123'
});

var gce = gcloud.compute();

var zone = gce.zone('us-central1-a');

description.full: A Zone object allows you to interact with a Google Compute Engine zone.
description.summary: A Zone object allows you to interact with a Google Compute Engine zone.

tags.string:
{string=} config.os - Specify the name of an OS, and we will use the
    latest version as the source image of a new boot disk. See
    [this list of accepted OS names](https://github.com/stephenplusplus/gce-images#accepted-os-names).
tags.name: config.os
tags.description:
• Specify the name of an OS, and we will use the latest version as the source image of a new boot disk. See
    this list of accepted OS names.

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this request.
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request.

tags.string:
{module:compute/operation} callback.operation - An operation object
    that can be used to check the status of the request.
tags.name: callback.operation
tags.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

tags.html:
var config = {
os: 'ubuntu',
sizeGb: 10
};

zone.createDisk('name', config, function(err, disk, operation, apiResponse) {
// disk is a Disk object.

// operation is an Operation object that can be used to check the status
// of the request.
});

description.full: Create a persistent disk in this zone.
description.summary: Create a persistent disk in this zone.

tags.string:
{object[]=} config.networkInterfaces - An array of configurations for
    this interface. This specifies how this interface should interact with
    other network services, such as connecting to the internet. Default:
    `[ { network: 'global/networks/default' } ]`
tags.name: config.networkInterfaces
tags.description:
• An array of configurations for this interface. This specifies how this interface should interact with
    other network services, such as connecting to the internet. Default:
    [ { network: 'global/networks/default' } ]

tags.string:
{string=} config.machineType - The machine type resource to use.
    Provide only the name of the machine, e.g. `n1-standard-16`. Refer to
    [Available Machine Types](https://goo.gl/jrHEbo). Default:
    `n1-standard-1`
tags.name: config.machineType
tags.description:
• The machine type resource to use. Provide only the name of the machine, e.g. n1-standard-16. Refer to
    Available Machine Types. Default:
    n1-standard-1

tags.string:
{string=} config.os - Specify the name of an OS, and we will use the
    latest version as the source image of a new boot disk. See
    [this list of accepted OS names](https://github.com/stephenplusplus/gce-images#accepted-os-names).
tags.name: config.os
tags.description:
• Specify the name of an OS, and we will use the latest version as the source image of a new boot disk. See
    this list of accepted OS names.

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this request.
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request.

tags.string:
{module:compute/operation} callback.operation - An operation object
    that can be used to check the status of the request.
tags.name: callback.operation
tags.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

tags.html:
//-
// Create a new instance using the latest Debian version as the source image
// for a new boot disk.
//-
var config = {
os: 'debian',
http: true,
tags: ['debian-server']
};

//-
// The above object will auto-expand behind the scenes to something like the
// following. The Debian version may be different when you run the command.
//-
var config = {
machineType: 'n1-standard-1',
disks: [
{
boot: true,
initializeParams: {
sourceImage:
'https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects' +
'/debian-cloud/global/images/debian-7-wheezy-v20150710'
}
}
],
networkInterfaces: [
{
network: 'global/networks/default'
}
],
tags: [
{
items: [
'debian-server',
'http-server'
]
}
]
};

function callback(err, vm, operation, apiResponse) {
// vm is a VM object.

// operation is an Operation object that can be used to check the status
// of the request.
}

zone.createVM('new-vm-name', config, callback);

description.full: Create a virtual machine in this zone.
description.summary: Create a virtual machine in this zone.

tags.string: {string} name - Name of the existing disk.
tags.name: name

description.full: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine disk in this zone.
description.summary: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine disk in this zone.

tags.string:
{boolean} options.autoPaginate - Have pagination handled
    automatically. Default: true.
tags.name: options.autoPaginate

tags.string:
{string} options.filter - Search filter in the format of
    `{name} {comparison} {filterString}`.
    - **`name`**: the name of the field to compare
    - **`comparison`**: the comparison operator, `eq` (equal) or `ne`
      (not equal)
    - **`filterString`**: the string to filter to. For string fields, this
      can be a regular expression.
tags.name: options.filter
tags.description:
• Search filter in the format of {name} {comparison} {filterString}.
    • name: the name of the field to compare
    • comparison: the comparison operator, eq (equal) or ne
      (not equal)
    • filterString: the string to filter to. For string fields, this
      can be a regular expression.

tags.string: {number} options.maxResults - Maximum number of disks to return.
tags.name: options.maxResults

tags.string:
{string} options.pageToken - A previously-returned page token
    representing part of the larger set of results to view.
tags.name: options.pageToken
tags.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this request.
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request.

tags.string: {module:compute/disk} callback.disks - Disk objects from this zone.
tags.name: callback.disks

tags.string:
{?object} callback.nextQuery - If present, query with this object to
    check for more results.
tags.name: callback.nextQuery
tags.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.

tags.html:
zone.getDisks(function(err, disks) {
// disks is an array of Disk objects.
});

//-
// To control how many API requests are made and page through the results
// manually, set autoPaginate to false.
//-
function callback(err, disks, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
if (nextQuery) {
// More results exist.
zone.getDisks(nextQuery, callback);
}
}

zone.getDisks({
autoPaginate: false
}, callback);

//-
// Get the disks from your project as a readable object stream.
//-
zone.getDisks()
.on('error', console.error)
.on('data', function(disk) {
// disk is a Disk object.
})
.on('end', function() {
// All disks retrieved.
});

//-
// If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent
// unnecessary processing and API requests.
//-
zone.getDisks()
.on('data', function(disk) {
this.end();
});

description.full: Get a list of disks in this zone.

{module:compute/operation} callback.operations - Operation objects

tags.name: callback.operations

tags.string:
{?object} callback.nextQuery - If present, query with this object to

tags.name: callback.nextQuery
tags.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.

tags.html:
zone.getOperations(function(err, operations) {
// operations is an array of Operation objects.
});

//-
// To control how many API requests are made and page through the results
// manually, set autoPaginate to false.
//-
function callback(err, operations, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
if (nextQuery) {
// More results exist.
zone.getOperations(nextQuery, callback);
}
}

zone.getOperations({
autoPaginate: false
}, callback);

//-
// Get the operations from your project as a readable object stream.
//-
zone.getOperations()
.on('error', console.error)
.on('data', function(operation) {
// operation is an Operation object.
})
.on('end', function() {
// All operations retrieved.
});

//-
// If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent
// unnecessary processing and API requests.
//-
zone.getOperations()
.on('data', function(operation) {
this.end();
});

{?object} callback.nextQuery - If present, query with this object to

tags.html:
zone.getVMs(function(err, vms) {
// vms is an array of VM objects.
});

//-
// To control how many API requests are made and page through the results
// manually, set autoPaginate to false.
//-
function callback(err, vms, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
if (nextQuery) {
// More results exist.
zone.getVMs(nextQuery, callback);
}
}

zone.getVMs({
autoPaginate: false
}, callback);

//-
// Get the VM instances from your project as a readable object stream.
//-
zone.getVMs()
.on('error', console.error)
.on('data', function(vm) {
// vm is a VM object.
})
.on('end', function() {
// All instances retrieved.
});

//-
// If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent
// unnecessary processing and API requests.
//-
zone.getVMs()
.on('data', function(vm) {
this.end();
});

description.full:
Make a new request object from the provided arguments and wrap the callback
to intercept non-successful responses.
description.summary:
Make a new request object from the provided arguments and wrap the callback
to intercept non-successful responses.

description.full:
Developer Documentation

These methods can be used with either a callback or as a readable object
stream. streamRouter is used to add this dual behavior.
description.body:
These methods can be used with either a callback or as a readable object
stream. streamRouter is used to add this dual behavior.

code:
streamRouter.extend(Zone, ['getDisks', 'getOperations', 'getVMs']);

module.exports = Zone;
